language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: definitely seems to be an 'r' in larantun
1. They; their; 3rd person plural non-focus or possesive pronoun
2. They; them. Third person plural, emphatic or focus pronoun
they (independent pronoun), them (suf. obj. prn.),their (suf. poss. prn.)
typo on page 25: should be third person, not second person
ɣ- is sometimes accreted in Sinaugoro
rarely used, reduced form isi/si used
vautul written as one word this time
Pron. pers. tonique. Ils, elles, eux. (3-ieme pers. du duel) (Rch [<]
